name: places/ChIJm4N-Olb3wokR4YAK4zBIb_M
formattedAddress: 131 W 135th St, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 131 W 135th St, New York, NY 10030, USA

originalText.text:
I can finally walk again. I spent over a year going to another PT and felt no difference. The pain in my hip felt worse and worse. Right before hip surgery I switched and found this place and I can finally walk again. Just a month before surgery I got stronger with Shivani (my PT) routines. After surgery I recovered quickly because of the strength in my leg. I have been going consistently for a few months and have made a remarkable recovery. I can’t not say enough about the team with Ana and the other staff members.
Cons:
* the place is small however it is so well managed you don’t feel it so much.
*This is not so much a con but you do the same routine every time which can feel boring and pointless but it’s doing the same routine that got me the strength I needed to walk.
Pros:
*while I was there for my hip primarily I had other issues and Shivani worked with me to ensure safety
*everytime i had a problem at home (going food shopping and walking) I spoke to Shivani and she gave me a routine to help with that deficiency.
*because the place is small it doesn’t rely on machines for strength which is actually a plus because you can do most of the routines at home
*Ana is an assistant and a gem. When Shivani is working with another patient she knows the routines so well she helps with the transitions and equipment.
PT is a partnership and you have to speak up and tell them the issues to have a positive experience.
I can’t say enough about this place and am so happy I found it!

originalText.text:
Frist i want to say that the PT staff and the office staff  are all very pleasant. The PHYSICAL therapist  who is in charge. Is really wonderful and works hard to help everyone.
One thing the weather  is really cold. Is there some way that you can let us inside in the building.  Today  is 26 degrees.   This is dangerous for elderly  to stay in the cold.   Please help.

originalText.text:
My first time going to Physical Therapy and new to the experience. The location in Harlem at 131 street West 135 Street is convenient and the morning appointments work with my schedule. On my first day the staff (Jennifer & Ana) was polite and professional. The therapist (Shivani) had a consultation with me to identified the best treatments and exercises to do.
*Overall this experience has been helpful and most beneficial for me in learning how to treat my problem areas in my everyday life.

originalText.text: Often an appointment is an opportunity to wait.  Therapists don’t show up on time, work with several patients at once and you get little individual attention.

text.text: Often an appointment is an opportunity to wait.  Therapists don’t show up on time, work with several patients at once and you get little individual attention.

originalText.text:
I had a terrible experience with Thermodynamics. The office smelled terrible and when I asked the front desk administrator what was causing the smell, he said that there seemed to be a dead rat somewhere that couldn't be found and offered me a mask to help. After a couple of weeks, I called to see if the smell had been rectified and the person who took my call pretended he didn't know what I was talking about, then said that he thinks that an exterminator handled the problem but that he wasn't sure if I would think it smells, and then he hung up on me.
If you don't mind being treated poorly and smelling the carcass of dead vermin, this place might work for you. But if you prefer to be treated with respect and honesty, I do not recommend Thermodynamics.
